results.body:
ASUNCION, Paraguay (AP) -- At least three people were dead and 13 were missing after a tourist boat capsized in the Paraguay River during a storm at the town of Carmelo Peralta in northern Paraguay, authorities said Wednesday night.

Aldo Saldivar, operations manager at the state National Emergency Secretariat, said the boat was carrying 11 Paraguayan crew members and 16 Brazilian tourists.

Saldivar said the tourists were on a fishing expedition to the Pantanal, a wetlands region straddling the border with Brazil about 370 miles (600 kilometers) north of Paraguay's capital, Asuncion.

He said the boat capsized in the harbor of Carmelo Peralta. "Apparently the accident occurred during a strong storm," he said.

Saldivar said 11 of the 27 people on the boat had been able to swim to shore after the vessel turned over. Navy divers were called in to look for the missing and three bodies had been recovered before the search was suspended at nightfall, he said.
results.title: Paraguay: 13 missing after tourist boat capsizes

Saldivar said the tourists were on a fishing expedition to the Pantanal, a wetlands region straddling the border with Brazil about 370 miles (600 kilometers) north of Paraguay's capital, Asuncion.

Saldivar said 11 of the 27 people on the boat had been able to swim to shore after the vessel turned over. Navy divers were called in to look for the missing and three bodies had been recovered before the search was suspended at nightfall, he said.

results.body:
At least three people were dead and 13 were missing after a tourist boat capsized in the Paraguay River during a storm at the town of Carmelo Peralta in northern Paraguay, authorities said Wednesday night.

Aldo Saldivar, operations manager at the state National Emergency Secretariat, said the boat was carrying 11 Paraguayan crew members and 16 Brazilian tourists.

Saldivar said the tourists were on a fishing expedition to the Pantanal, a wetlands region straddling the border with Brazil about 370 miles (600 kilometers) north of Paraguay's capital, Asuncion.

results.body:
ASUNCION, Paraguay (AP) Authorities in Paraguay say at least 15 people are missing after a tourist boat apparently capsized Wednesday in the Paraguay River during a storm at the town of Carmelo Peralta.

Emergency agency operating manager Aldo Saldivar says the boat was carrying Brazilian tourists who had come for a fishing expedition in the Pantanal region, about 370 miles (600 kilometers) north of the capital of Asuncion. He says witnesses reported that five tourists were rescued.

Saldivar says navy divers are looking for the missing.
results.title: Paraguay: 15 missing after tourist boat capsizes

results.body: At least three people were dead and 13 were missing after a tourist boat capsized in the Paraguay River during a storm, authorities said Wednesday night. The boat was carrying 11 Paraguayan crew members and 16 Brazilian tourists as the incident happened at the town of Carmelo Peralta in northern Paraguay, AP said. They were on a fishing expedition to the Pantanal, a wetlands region straddling the border with Brazil about 600km north of Paraguay's capital, Asuncion. Eleven of the 27 people on the boat had been able to swim to shore after the vessel turned over.
results.title: 3 dead, 13 missing as tourist boat capsizes in Paraguay

results.body:
Police in Paraguay say three people were killed when a tourist boat capsized on the River Paraguay.

They said 14 passengers managed to swim ashore, but 10 were still missing.

The boat, Dream of the Pantanal, sank during a heavy storm near the town of Carmelo Peralta in northern Paraguay, about 600km (370 miles) north of the capital, Asuncion.

Officials said it was carrying 11 Paraguayan crew and 16 Brazilian tourists.

Navy divers have been called in to help with the search.

Aldo Saldivar of Paraguay's National Emergency Secretariat said the tourists were on a fishing expedition to the Pantanal, one of the world's largest freshwater wetlands, which stretches across areas of Brazil, Paraguay and Bolivia.
results.title: Tourist boat capsizes in Paraguay

results.body:
JEFFERSONVILLE, IN (WAVE) - Leaders in Jeffersonville are dropping plans for permanent boat docking spots at a new Ohio River Marina.

The revised plans for the marina call for 15 spots for temporary boat docking and eliminates plans for 22 permanent slips. The change comes after new construction bids came in higher than expected.

[PREVIOUS STORY: NEWS & TRIBUNE: Jeffersonville marina estimates much higher than expected]

Since the new marina is meant to entice boaters to the city, Mayor Mike Moore said the spots for temporary docking are the economic engine of the project.

Moore said he would also like to see a fishing pier in the plans. The city council hopes to review preliminary sketches next month.
results.title: Permanent bock slips dropped form Jeffersonville marina plan

results.body:
All the details including links to the Spectator Guide and Traffic Guide are on the Chattanooga DOT special events page:

http://www.chattanooga.gov/transportation/traffic-engineering-a-operations/special-events-a-street-closures

The Tennessee River will be closed to pleasure crafts between Ross's Landing and the Chickamauga Dam from midnight, Saturday September 27th until noon on Sunday, September 28th. This includes the Rivermont Park and Tennessee Riverpark boat ramps
results.title: 2014 Little Debbie IRONMAN preparations and road closures

results.body:
We live in a world of vehicles and machinery made up of a million different moving parts and hyper-specialized tech guts. Using nothing more than a modified moped motor, Gaspard Tiné-Berès and Tristan Kopp of Re-Do Studio imagined a future where a single modular Engine Block can be used to power everything from a small boat to a cement mixer.

They put together the project as part of Ljubljana's 50th Biennial of Industrial Design, and started with a (very) creative vision: In an "apocalyptic" future ravaged by economic turmoil, these mix-and-match generators will be the key to a new kind of hands-on maker movement, where people (re)learn what it takes to make their goods go. In other words: "A guy fixes old tools by using a unique engine to run all of them," as Tiné-Berès told We Make Money Not Art.

It's conceptual, sure, but they also made it work with a prototype proof of concept (shot in a ultra-dramatic, sci-fi style vid). The duo partnered with Tomos, a Slovenian scooter manufacturer, to source the engine, then adapted it to work with a boat, a saw, a cement mixer, and -- of course -- a moped.

The reality of a one-size-fits-all engine is not necessarily practical, but the idea does speak to a kind of industrious tinkering that most folks wouldn't bother to consider in their day to day lives -- which falls in line with their Re-Done home appliance and bike projects from a few years back which saw cheap, bound-for-the-trash miscellany being fixed up rather than tossed out. Apocalyptic futures aside, their commitment to encouraging resourcefulness rather than waste is one we should definitely be paying attention to now. [We Make Money Not Art]
results.title: This Modified Moped Engine Powers a Boat, Concrete Mixer, and Woodsaw

results.body:
Al menos 15 personas desaparecieron el miércoles en aguas del río Paraguay al zozobrar una embarcación enfrente del puerto Carmelo Peralta, al norte de la capital paraguaya.

Aldo Saldívar, gerente operativo de la estatal Secretaría de Emergencia Nacional, dijo a los periodistas que la embarcación con bandera paraguaya transportaba a turistas brasileños que llegaban a Carmelo Peralta de una jornada de pesca en las cercanías del pantanal brasileño, a unos 600 kilómetros al norte de Asunción.

"No tenemos aún la identidad de los desaparecidos. Los buzos de la Armada están trabajando. Aparentemente, el accidente ocurrió debido a un fuerte temporal", explicó.

En tanto, el periodista Nicolás Feltes de la radioemisora Olimpo, ubicada en la zona del percance, informó que "la embarcación zozobró a tan sólo 30 metros del precario puerto de la localidad Carmelo Peralta".

"Testigos que estaban en tierra divisaron el accidente del barquito Sueños del Pantanal, propiedad del paraguayo Silvio Penayo, e informaron que unos 12 turistas supuestamente brasileños no fueron encontrados aún, cinco pasajeros sobrevivieron y los tres tripulantes, incluyendo el dueño, son buscados en medio de la noche", relató.
results.title: Paraguay: 15 desaparecidos en naufragio en río

results.body:
Un fuerte temporal causу el vuelco del barco "Sueсo de Paranб". Gentileza.

La causa del vuelco de la embarcación habría sido el temporal con vientos fuertes en la zona de Carmelo Pertalta, según la Policía. Los pasajeros y víctimas del desastres serían todos brasileños.

Marinos brasileños y paraguayos de la zona, así como la Policía Nacional y pobladores de Isla Margarita, trabajan para rescatar a las víctimas. Incluso, algunas víctimas ya fueron rescatadas de las aguas.

La embarcación, que posee el nombre "Sueño de Pantanal", transportaba a varios turistas en el momento del accidente. El motivo que ocasionó el hundimiento habría sido por una intensa tormenta que se registró en el lugar.

El periodista Nicolás Feltes, de la Radio "Olimpo FM", informó a radio 1000 AM que "es seguro que fallecieron 15 personas. Los accidentados no tuvieron el tiempo suficiente para ponerse los chalecos salvavidas al momento en que volcaba la embarcación, dijo el trabajador a la emisora capitalina.

Los cuerpos de dos hombres mayores de edad que formaban parte de la embarcaciуnl, que naufragу en la tarde de este miйrcoles en el rнo Paraguay, fueron encontrados por el equipo de bъsqueda. Maсana continuarбn la bъsqueda de los desaparecidos, informу la Policнa de Carmelo Peralta.

La información refiere que alrededor de las 17:30 horas del miércoles, el barco "Sueño de Pantanal" se encontraba en la zona de Carmelo Peralta volcó a consecuencia de un temporal, se desconoce la cantidad de personas a bordo.

Los tripulantes, en su mayoría turistas, se encontraban en un recorrido que cubre el trayecto Carmelo Peralta-Olimpo. Cuando se desato una tormenta con ráfagas de vientos fuertes, lo que habría ocasionado el vuelco, con el barco en su capacidad máxima.
results.title: Temporal vuelca una embarcación en Carmelo Peralta

results.body:
Una embarcación volcó esta tarde en la zona de Carmelo Peralta, Alto Paraguay, cuando transportaba a turistas. La Policía Nacional presume que 20 personas están desaparecidas, mientras que se argumenta que unas 15 ya fallecieron.

En la tarde de este miércoles, una embarcación volcó en la zona de Carmelo Peralta, del departamento de Alto Paraguay.

La embarcación, que posee el nombre "Sueño de Pantanal", transportaba a varios turistas en el momento del accidente. Hasta el momento unas 20 personas continúan desaparecidas.

El motivo que ocasionó el hundimiento habría sido por una intensa tormenta que se registró en el lugar.

Por su parte, el periodista Nicolás Feltes, de la Radio "Olimpo FM", dijo a radio 1000 AM que "es seguro que fallecieron 15 personas". "Los accidentados no tuvieron el tiempo suficiente para ponerse los chalecos salvavidas", agregó.

Comentó que mañana se intensificarán las búsquedas correspondientes, atendiendo que a la noche se dificulta el trabajo de los oficiales.
results.title: Vuelco de embarcación deja 20 desaparecidos

results.body:
Una embarcación que transportaba turistas en la zona de Carmelo Peralta volcó en el río Paraguay a consecuencia de los vientos fuertes de un breve temporal. La Policía reporta 20 personas desaparecidas hasta el momento.

Una embarcación con capacidad para aproximadamente 20 personas que cubre el trayecto Carmelo Peralta-Olimpo, volcó esta tarde, aproximadamente a las 17:30 en el río Paraguay, en la zona de Carmelo Peralta, cuando transportaba pasajeros. La causa del vuelco habría sido el temporal con vientos fuertes.

Generalmente estas embarcaciones son utilizadas en su mayoría por brasileños, informó el corresponsal de ABC Color, Carlos Almirón. La embarcación que volcó aparentemente estaba llena de pasajeros. La Policía de la zona habla de 20 desaparecidos hasta el momento.

Personal de la Marina brasileña y paraguaya de la zona, así como la Policía Nacional y pobladores de Isla Margarita, trabajan para rescatar a las víctimas. La mayoría de los pasajeros serían brasileños de la zona de Paraná.

El temporal, además de tumbar la embarcación, causó destrozos en la zona poblada. Hay muchas casas destechadas, árboles caídos y antenas que cayeron en la zona. La comunicación se dificulta, reportó Juan Gamarra, de la radio Nativa de Isla Margarita.
results.title: Vuelca barco con turistas
